message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of broadcasting packets in wireless networks, which is a topic related to network protocols and communication in computer networks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also proposes a new dynamic algorithm that achieves the broadcast capacity when the underlying network topology is a directed acyclic graph (DAG), which involves the study of graph theory and algorithms. Hence, cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is another likely category. The paper also utilizes local queue-length information and in-order packet delivery to all network nodes, which involves the study of information theory and signal processing. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is another possible category. The paper also proposes a new algorithm that achieves the broadcast capacity without using any global topological structures such as spanning trees, which involves the study of control theory and systems engineering. Hence, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is another possible category. Finally, the paper also presents simulation results that show the proposed algorithm has superior delay performance as compared to tree-based approaches, which involves the study of machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible category.
